sentence.text: regulation of cell proliferation, a new member of the cell division cycle associated family of genes, is involved in embryonic development and dysregulated in various types of human cancer.
Importantly, depletion of regulation of cell proliferation strongly reduced the tumorigenicity and distant colonization capacities of TNBC cells in vivo.

Furthermore, regulation of cell proliferation increased the expression of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, a marker of aggressive breast cancer that is involved in tumor progression, by enhancing the transcriptional activity of its promoter.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
